item.title: Notes: Assessment of adult attitudes towards continuing education
item.description: References Citekey: @darkenwald1988assessment Darkenwald GG and Hayes ER (1988). “Assessment of adult attitudes towards continuing education.” International journal of lifelong education, 7(3), pp. 197-204. Notes Highlights Most definitions of attitude are similar to that proposed by Gagne and Briggs (1974: 62):‘An internal state which affects an individual’s choice of action toward some object, person, or event’. Little wonder, then, that the construct of ‘attitude’ occupies a central place in current theory on participation in continuing (or adult) education (Cross 1981;Darkenwald and Merriam 1982; Houle1984; Rubenson 1977).
